Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery slightly ribbed vessel, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink, writ large.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394640) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394640)
